intro: Cephalidium, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in coastal areas or brackish water environments. Cephalidium species are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of hibiscus. The leaves are usually palmately lobed, and the stems may have a fleshy, succulent appearance. These plants play an important role in their ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
